[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: disassembler] [Label Map Integrity] Can malformed branch instructions with invalid offsets cause label_map construction to fail or produce incorrect labels? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: disassembler] [Module Alias Generation] When generating short names for used modules, can name collision logic create ambiguous aliases? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: disassembler] [Constant Deserialization] When displaying ld_const bytecode, can invalid constant pool entries cause deserialization failures? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: disassembler] [Type Argument Formatting] For generic instructions, can malformed type_parameters signature indices cause panic during ty_args() formatting? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Module: disassembler] [Script Pseudo Module] When converting scripts to modules for disassembly, can the pseudo_script_module_id() handling cause confusion with actual modules? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Validation Bypass] Can a malicious actor disable validation checks via ModuleBuilderOptions.validate=false to generate invalid bytecode that bypasses all safety checks? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Bytecode Version Manipulation] Can manipulating ModuleBuilderOptions.bytecode_version allow generation of bytecode incompatible with current VM version, causing consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Dependency Module Tampering] Can providing malicious modules via --deps flag poison the context_modules, causing all subsequently assembled modules to reference corrupted handles? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [File System Race Condition] In run() function, can a TOCTOU race between reading input file and writing output file cause overwrite of critical files? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Error Reporting Information Leakage] Can diagnostic error messages leak sensitive information about internal module structure or imported dependencies? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Output Directory Traversal] Can the --output-dir parameter be manipulated to write assembled bytecode to arbitrary filesystem locations via path traversal? (High)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Deterministic Serialization] Is module/script serialization via serialize_for_version() fully deterministic across different architectures and compilation environments? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Module vs Script Confusion] Can a unit declared as 'script' be converted to module or vice versa, bypassing entry point and signature restrictions? (High)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Circular Dependency Detection] Can circular dependencies between assembled module and context modules cause infinite recursion during handle import? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Multiple Input Files] The run() function expects exactly one input file - can bypassing this check allow batch processing that causes handle index collisions? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Malformed Bytecode Injection] Can assembled bytecode contain instructions that appear valid to the assembler but violate Move VM invariants, causing runtime crashes during transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Gas Metering Bypass] Can carefully crafted bytecode with infinite loops or expensive operations bypass gas metering, causing validator DoS during execution? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Type Confusion Attack] Can type instantiations be crafted to confuse the VM's type checker, allowing operations on wrong types that violate resource safety? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Reference Safety Violation] Can assembled bytecode create dangling references or double-borrows that bypass Move's borrow checker at runtime? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Global Storage Corruption] Can move_to/move_from instructions be assembled to access global storage without proper permission checks, stealing or corrupting resources? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Ability Constraint Bypass] Can assembled modules violate ability constraints (copy/drop/key/store) to duplicate resources or persist non-storable values? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Signature Forgery] Can function signatures be crafted to match existing well-known functions, allowing transaction routing to malicious implementations? (High)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Module Upgrade Confusion] Can assembled modules masquerade as system modules (0x1::*) to override core framework functions during module publishing? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Struct Layout Manipulation] Can mismatched struct field layouts between declaration and usage cause memory corruption when packing/unpacking structs? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/lib.rs] [Attack Vector] [Bytecode Verification Bypass] Does assembled bytecode undergo the same rigorous verification as compiler-generated bytecode, or can verification steps be skipped? (Critical)
